Entries.default:
When you first enter the workshop, you find the Vailian scientist, Iverra, and a large aumaua man in heated conversation. He gestures wildly, his mouth is set in a hard grimace that bares his pointed teeth. Iverra regards him with her hands planted firmly on her hips.

When he spots you, his eyes widen.

When you first enter the workshop, you find two Royal Deadfire Company engineers in heated conversation. The man dressed as a coralmason gestures wildly, his mouth is set in a hard grimace that bares his pointed teeth. The engineer regards him with his hands planted firmly on his hips.

When the coralmason spots you, his eyes widen.
"You! This area is strictly off-limits to non-Company personnel! What are you doing here?"
"Praise be. The coral in the harbor is growing out of control, and we've found no way to stop it. We're at our wit's end." He mops a sheen of sweat from his broad brow with a handkerchief.
"I've surmised that a magical disturbance must be the source of the problem."
"The Huana's records show that an ancient Engwithan ruin, Cignath Mór, once stood at that approximate location."
"The Huana here tell tales of an Engwithan ruin, Cignath Mór, that once stood at that approximate location."
"That's me. How can I help?"
"I'm not making any promises until I know what's in it for me."
"Give me the short version, I haven't got all day."
"How terribly reasonable of you." He cuts a sharp glare toward Iverra, who only shrugs.
"Perguono, take this. It is my masterpiece, ac?" She heaves a large, bulbous helm off a nearby shelf and hands it to you.
"As is your prerogative."
"You're not exactly short-handed here. Why not send your own people?"
"I'll make it my top priority."
"Don't rush me. I'll get to it when I damn well please."
"None among the Company share your particular, ah, history with Engwithan artifacts."
"Here, take this. Careful you don't drop it, now." He heaves a large, bulbous helm off a nearby shelf and hands it to you.
"So far as I can tell, the most likely candidate is a strange magical signature emanating from some place off the southeast coast of the island, deep beneath the sea."
"We suspect something within that ruin is source of our... inconvenience."
"The helmet will allow you to breathe underwater for a time. It should work long enough for you to find the disturbance." "...If you hurry."
"The helmet should allow you to breathe underwater for time enough to deal with the disturbance - provided, of course, that you hurry."
"I do not doubt that something in that ruin is the source of the trouble."
"You are, in essence, the perfect candidate for our experi- er, our research."
"The Royal Deadfire Company thanks you for your assistance, Watcher."
"And your bravery. Auret augori!"
"Temper yourself, man. The hazanui said she would send someone soon. You are he, are you not?"
Entries.female: "Temper yourself, man. The hazanui said she would send someone soon. You are she, are you not?"

Entries.default: "Calm, aimico. Is this not the casità your hazanui said she would send?" Iverra rolls her eyes.
Entries.female: "Calm, aimico. Is this not the casità your hazanui said she would send?"

Entries.default:
"But you'll have to take that up with the fleet master. I haven't the authority to give you much more than directions, I'm afraid.

"Now, if we might get back to the topic at hand..."
